FERTILE.Definition: making it easier for a particular activity to happen

BREEDING GROUND.Definition: a place or situation that causes something to develop

VOLATILE.Definition: likely to change for the worse suddenly

RECESSION.Definition: a period of economic depression or failure

GREED.Definition: a desire to earn more and more money

LENDING.Definition: giving money to someone under the agreement to pay it back later

COMMENTATORS.Definition: reporters providing information and comments about a situation

PROMINENCE.Definition: the state of being easy to see

HOTBED.Definition: a place where a lot of a particular activity happens

LACK.Definition: the fact that something is not available

BACKDROP.Definition: the setting or the background of an event

SLOGAN.Definition: a short phrase that is easy to remember, used to draw attention

BLANKETS.Definition: large pieces of wool or similar material used as a covering

MAKESHIFT.Definition: made using whatever is available for temporary use

EXISTENTIAL.Definition: relating to the matter of our existence

DONORS.Definition: people who give money for a cause

PUNISHED.Definition: made to suffer a penalty because they had done something wrong

RETHOUGHT.Definition: considered again in order to change it

CONSENSUS.Definition: accepted decision among a group of people

ITERATION.Definition: an event that is going to be repeated in the future

ATTRIBUTED.Definition: thought that it was caused by

CONVERGED.Definition: came from different directions and met

FURTHERING.Definition: promoting or helping the development of something

THE PUBLIC CONSCIOUSNESS.Definition: a set of shared beliefs and ideas

THE ESTABLISHMENT.Definition: a group of people holding most of the power and influence

UNEXPECTED.Definition: not expected or not considered likely to happen

LEGACIES.Definition: things are left or handed down for future use

WAGE.Definition: an amount of money paid to an employee

TRACE BACK.Definition: find the beginning of something by following a series of events in the past

OVER-EDUCATED.Definition: having been educated more than it is necessary

SOWED THE SEEDS.Definition: created a situation in which something is likely to happen

GRASSROOTS MOVEMENTS.Definition: movements organised by groups of people in order to bring political and social change

ASSESS.Definition: judge or decide the importance of something
